MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Raytheon Company | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Tom M. Mitchell

MCQ: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cyberdyne | b: Cybertron | c: Cybernet | d: Cyberware

MCQ: Who proposed the early mathematical models of neural networks in machine learning?
Choices: a: Walter Pitts | b: Warren McCulloch | c: Donald Hebb | d: Arthur Samuel

MCQ: What did Tom M. Mitchell define as the tasks in which machine learning is concerned?
Choices: a: Cognitive processes | b: Experience, tasks, and performance measure | c: Pattern recognition | d: Neural structure

MCQ: What are the two objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To develop new algorithms and models | b: To classify data and make predictions | c: To study human cognitive processes | d: To analyze sonar signals and speech patterns
